data.text: @calimagirl That's too bad, they don't hurt at all and they're so beneficial. Too me, it's like going to a spa. You lay down, they put the needles where they should go and then you lie there for about 45 minutes and it's so relaxing, I fall asleep.

@LifeOfMarie267 Same! I have tiny veins and after much poking with no results, they end up taking it out of my hand. 

It's so exhausting to watch them try the right arm and then the left, and then give up and go to my hand. Every time. 🙄
@Sammie1863_ @RPat360 Yeah, I comfort myself thinking that it doesn’t look worse than a blood test

@RPat360 Oh, that ‘s amazing (minus the being bitten)!
You sure could write an interesting book about your life, from the glimpses I know
@RPat360 They’ve told me about he benefits of accupunture many times, but I just can’t. Just to think about all those needles... *shudders*
@LifeOfMarie267 It really didn't hurt at all, I barely felt it. I think some people are better at giving shots than others, too.
@calimagirl @RPat360 You are not alone.  Always helps me to not look when they give it.  For me, this one was pretty tame at injection.
@calimagirl I used to do wildlife rehab, and I've been bitten by so many wild animals I've lost count. Being bitten hurts more than a shot.

@calimagirl I wish I could be with you when you get yours. I got so many shots as a kid, I kind of got used to them. I was always stepping on rusty nails and needing a tetnus shot, and they're the worst. The rest seem easy after that, and I do love acupuncture. It's so effective.
@RPat360 I envy you! I am terrified of needles (like, really terrified), so when it's my turn I'm gonna be quite nervous, tbh. But can't wait to get vaccinated
